result.execSummary:
The defendant Micayla N. Cork was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Micayla N. Cork is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Micayla N. Cork was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Micayla N. Cork was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone, through any other person, or by any other means with:  Gage Lewallen, or any known users, possessors or dealers of illegal substances.
May apply for expungement if she successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant to be subject to frequent and random testing by her agent.

Defendant to reside where her agent tells her to reside.  Curfew, if any, to be determined by her agent.  

Keep probation agent apprised of when and where her voluntary in-patient treatment is.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Recorded:  Defendant appears in person.  Has reached maximum levels of services that can be provided.  This is last day of treatment court.  She read her writing assignment.
Adult treatment court.  Changes at work discussed.  Choices she has made, what more can treatment court do for her?  Think about it.
Hearing on July 31, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Adult treatment court.  She is assistant manager at 4 Seasons.  Had issues last weekend.  Reach out to the team.  Tested positive.  Ordered to participate in relapse group.  Give J.L. and agent her work schedule by Friday at noon.  Must appear Monday-Friday until next court date to test within 3 hours.  No travel privileges until next court date.
Hearing on July 17, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  Discussion on work history.  Team removing bracelet.  Contact JASO tomorrow to arrange to get them removed.
Hearing on July 3, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  Saw a movie.  Job going good.  Goals set.
Hearing on June 19, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  Things going good.  Life plan after treatment court discussed.  Set goals and time lines.  How can treatment court help.  Working on getting her driver's license.
Hearing on June 5, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Treatment Court - Told to change her NOH to 5/22 as the 5/8 date is off.  Working at Four Seasons and Denny's, talked about her work schedule.  Talked about meetings and classes she attends.  Stated some of her short-term and long-term goals.  To think about ways the team can help her reach her goals somehow.  Work on what she owes and a strategy on how to pay them and save money at the same time.
Hearing on May 8, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  She didn't download her bracelet for 3 weeks.  Her goals discussed.  She wants to finish.
Hearing on April 24, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Adult treatment court.  Treatment went well.  She is back to work. 1 green card given.

Today's Adult treatment court hearing canceled due to inclement weather.

Adult treatment court hearing.  Appeared in custody.  In a holding pattern now.
Hearing on September 5, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  Recorded by FTR.  Appeared in custody.  Things going ok in jail.  Discussion about character references.

Hearing on August 8, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Adult Treatment Court.  Defendant appeared, in custody.  Discussion on recent events.  Thought processes, what she could have done differently.

Hearing on May 23, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant is present.  Talked about living at home, work.  Applying to school for this fall.  Has done an application for Phase 4 and is has benn approved and will move forward.
Hearing on May 9, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on April 25, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Adult Treatment Court.  Recorded by FTR.  Discussion on the conference she recently attended.  SCRAM unit not needed anymore.  She completed community service.  Can call in to see if she needs to test from now on.  Meet with coordinator to get phase up paperwork.  Green card given.

Adult Treatment Court.  Going to the conference is approved.  Talk with her agent regarding the conference.  Community service discussed.  Got information regarding school.  Arrangments made for the car.

Adult treatment court.  Living arrangments going good.  Discussion on moving forward in treatment court.  Long term goals.   Green card given.
Hearing on February 28, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Adult treatment court.  Work very busy, working lots of hours.  Team is concerned.  Another missed test.  Connected with her agent.  1 day jail ordered.  24 hours.  GPS will be installed.
Hearing on February 14, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Adult Treatment Court.  Having difficulties meeting and talking with her probation agent.  She would be OK with changing her agent.  She should talk to the probation supervisor.  Team is concerned about this.  If no results from the supervisor, let J.L. know.  She has done community service.  She can have her GPS devise removed tomorrow morning at the Sheriff's Dept.  Phase II completed.  Given 2 green cards.

Treatment Court - Discussed new living arrangement.  Discussed violation of rules.  Judge instructed defendant to contact Food Pantry to perfrom 15 hours community service within a month.  Can talk to J.L. about other options if can't get all the hours there.  Discussed work issues.
Hearing on January 17, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Hearing on January 3, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Adult Treatment Court.  Thanksgiving went good.  Holiday plans discussed.  May move back with family again for awhile.  Importance of honesty with the treatment court team stressed by the court.  2 Green cards given.

Hearing is recorded:
Discussed monitoring and how things are going.  Talked about manager position she has with her employment.  Discussed curfew, restrictions, stressors, holidays.
Hearing on December 6, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Hearing on August 30, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Hearing on August 16, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant present.  Discussed employment - now full time and another possible job opportunity; apprenticeship potential now available.
Hearing on August 2, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Recorded by FTR.   Treatment court.  Participant appeared in person.  Missed an appointment with agent.  Testing good.
Hearing on July 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Adult Treatment Court. Participant present, and Team Present.  Phase 1 completed.  Certificate presented.  She may go full time at work.  Green card give by C.S.
Recorded. Adult Treatment Court. Participant present, and Team Present. Work going good. Discussed housing.
Hearing on June 21, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Hearing on May 24, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Treatment Court - Doing well with commitments and job.  Has made arrangements to have Wednesdays off of work for treatment commitments. May 5 has an appointment set up with L.M. at UWEX.  There is no Treatment Court on May 10 as there is a conference.

Adult Treatment Court.  Participant, in person, in custody, and Team present.  Work is going good.  Called and canceled an appointment with B.  Can't cancel appointments.  Treatment is top priority.  Work with Stein to make regular appointments.  Test results good.  Class going good.  Call J.L. tomorrow.
Hearing on April 26, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

She has been staffed and will be accepted.  She started a job a little over 2 weeks ago.  It's going well and likes it a lot.  Would be interested in the financial literacy help.  Taking an on-line class and working for certification to possibly teach a class.  Discussion regarding relationships.
Adult Treatment Court.  Participant, in person, in custody, and Team present.  Recorded by FTR.  Observing court.  Court explained a little of what the court is about, if she is accepted.
applied bond on file to court costs.  Sent assessment report to DOC

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  All other pending charges to be dismissed outright. Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charges she is pleading to.  She understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.   Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Counts 1 and 2.   Joint recommendation for 4 years probation.  Concurrent.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 4 years probation.  Concurrent.  May apply for expungement, if she successfully completes probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Keep probation apprised of when and where the voluntary in-patient treatment.  No contact with G.L., or any known users, possessors or dealers of illegal substances.  Subject to frequent testing by her agent.  CC, DNA surcharge and sample.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to random testing, per agent.  Reside where agent tells you to reside.  Curfew, if any to be set by probation agent.  Obtain and maintain employment.
Information filed with the Court.

Court questioned the defendant on her understanding of the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  She stated she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to a preliminary hearing.
person who posted the $1,500.00 cash bond at the sheriff's dept would not give name, so no surety information.

Covers case No.'s 15CF142, 15CF177,15CF186,15CM94 and 16CF16.  She is only to be released to care and custody of her parents. She is not to leave their care unless they give permission for religious/court purposes. Not to leave the home without her parents permission.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: G. L.   Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 01:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 01:30 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Matousek appeared by telephone.  Defendant requesting that the defedant be allowed to go to in patient treatment.  Court denied request.  Defendant has not demonstrated that she can abide by the rules set by the court.  Defendant is also a high risk for flight.
from Attorney Matousek.

This bond covers 15CF177,15CF142, 15CM94 and 15CF186:   Only release to care and custody of her father or mother.  Not to leave her father or mother's custody until she is at Timberline Knolls.  Defendant must be in their care and custody at all times.  Not to leave Timberline Knolls facility without approval by the court, other than for purposees of being escorted by the facility and under their care and custody directly.  Upon discharge from the facility, she may only be released to her parent and must return directly to court.  If court not in session, return to the Jackson County Jail until she can be before the court.  Defendant is not to leave Timberline Knolls facility without proper discharge.  Must be with her parent at all times, or at the treatment facility under their care and custody.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: G. L.. Not to associate with any known drug users or dealers.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Matousek did not appear.  Court received a fax from Attorney Matousek. Defendant accepted into treatment at Timberline Knolls.  May be admitted today.  30 minimum treatment facility.  Insurance covers 7 days, and thereafter reviewed.  State requests strict release conditions.  Be with father until delivered to the facility.  No day pass without supervision.  Return to court immediately after discharge.  Father advises that they will check in tomorrow by 4:00 p.m.  Court ordered:  Defendant to be released by 9:00 am. tomorrow.  Only release to care and custody of father.  Signature bond in same amount and conditions to be effective starting at 9:00 am on October 24, 2015.  No to leave their custody until she is at Timberline Knolls.  In their care and custody at all times.  Not to leave facility without approval by the court, other than for purposes of being escorted by the facility and under their care and custody directly.  Upon discharge, only release to parent and return directly to court. If court not in session, return to JASO until she can be before the court.  Not to leave treatment facility without proper discharge.  No contact with G.L.  Must be with parents at all times or at the treatment facility under their care and custody.
